newsitem.title: USA: Rubin repeats strong dollar in U.S. best interests.
newsitem.headline: Rubin repeats strong dollar in U.S. best interests.

text.p: Treasury Secretary Robert Rubin Thursday reiterated his support for a strong dollar.
"Our position is as it has been all along," he said. "A strong dollar is in the best interests of the United States. It tends to promote low inflation, low interest rates."

Talking to reporters after a forum sponsored by the John F. Kennedy School, Rubin added that U.S. economic growth is solid and inflation low. "We are having a strong economy. We have low unemployment and we have generally healthy conditions," he said.
